user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_uname_type:
```c
_MHD_static_inline enum MHD_DigestAuthUsernameType
get_rq_uname_type (const struct MHD_RqDAuth *params)
{
  if (NULL != params->username.value.str)
  {
    if (NULL == params->username_ext.value.str)
      return params->userhash ?
             MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_USERHASH :
             MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_STANDARD;
    else  /* Both 'username' and 'username*' are used */
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_INVALID;
  }
  else if (NULL != params->username_ext.value.str)
  {
    if (! params->username_ext.quoted && ! params->userhash &&
        (MHD_DAUTH_EXT_PARAM_MIN_LEN <= params->username_ext.value.len) )
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_EXTENDED;
    else
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_INVALID;
  }

  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_MISSING;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other fragments do not need investigation with respect to MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 because they do not involve pointers that could or should be const-qualified: the function parameter is already a pointer to a const-qualified struct (const struct MHD_RqDAuth *params), the uses of params->username_ext.value.len and boolean members (params->username_ext.quoted, params->userhash) are value reads rather than pointer dereferences, and the return expressions and enum handling do not involve non-const pointer types. The only places where pointer members are read (the three conditions above checking value.str) may indicate underlying pointer types that should be const-qualified and therefore are flagged for investigation; all other code paths do not present pointer-to-non-const concerns for Rule 8.13.
